title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9-8-7-6 points: Stronger Essays

These essays will demonstrate the following qualities with varying degrees of effectiveness:

9

  • a clear, well-developed thesis (may be implicit)

  • provides a coherent assessment of the extent to which Enlightenment ideas shaped Revolutionary policies

  • demonstrates relevant knowledge of Enlightenment ideas on religion and society

  • identifies specific Revolutionary policies and links them to the Enlightenment ideas

8

  • supports the thesis with appropriate evidence

  • may contain minor errors, or a single major error; even a “9” need not be flawless

7

  • a clear thesis (may be implicit)

  • provides some assessment of the extent to which the Enlightenment ideas shaped Revolutionary policies

  • includes some Enlightenment ideas on religion and society

  • describes specific Revolutionary policies, perhaps unevenly

6

  • supports the thesis with evidence, perhaps unevenly

  • may contain a number of minor errors, or a single major error.

Mixed 5 – 4 (These scores should be assigned judiciously.)
These essays will demonstrate the following qualities with varying degrees of effectiveness:

5

  • contains a thesis, perhaps superficial or simplistic

  • responds to the terms of the question, perhaps thinly or incompletely

    1. addresses the influence of Enlightenment ideas on Revolutionary policies

    2. references some Enlightenment ideas on religion or society

4

  • contains adequate or marginal supporting evidence about Enlightenment and French Revolution

  • may contain significant errors

Weaker 3-2-1-0
These essays in this category will demonstrate the following qualities in varying degrees. Essays scored 0 or 1 may attempt to address the question but fail to do so.

3

  • thesis confused and unfocused OR weakly supported.

  • misconstrues the question, or omits major tasks.

    1. refers minimally to Enlightenment ideas and Revolutionary policies

    2. may be off-task; omits discussion of Enlightenment or French Revolution

    3. Inadequately or partially identifies Enlightenment ideas and Revolutionary policies

  • shows little understanding of the Enlightenment and the French Revolution

2

  • minimal concrete evidence

  • may contain numerous errors

1

  • thesis largely irrelevant OR unsupported.

  • misunderstands the question and omits major tasks

    1. refers vaguely, if at all, to ideas of the Enlightenment and/or policies of French Revolution

    2. may be totally off-task

  • shows virtually no understanding of Enlightenment ideas and Revolutionary policies

0

  • evidence irrelevant, missing or tangential

  • may contain a number of glaring errors
